Astro](/docs/installation/astro) [Laravel](/docs/installation/laravel) [Gatsby\\
Gatsby](/docs/installation/gatsby) [React\\
Manual](/docs/installation/manual)

## [Link to section](\#typescript) TypeScript

This project and the components are written in TypeScript. We recommend using TypeScript for your project as well.

However we provide a JavaScript version of the components as well. The JavaScript version is available via the [cli](/docs/cli).

To opt-out of TypeScript, you can use the `tsx` flag in your `components.json` file.

components.json

```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm
{
  "style": "default",
  "tailwind": {
    "config": "tailwind.config.js",
    "css": "src/app/globals.css",
    "baseColor": "zinc",
    "cssVariables": true
  },
  "rsc": false,
  "tsx": false,
  "aliases": {
    "utils": "~/lib/utils",
    "components": "~/components"
  }
}
```

Copy

To configure import aliases, you can use the following `jsconfig.json`:

jsconfig.json

```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "paths": {
      "@/*": ["./*"]
    }
  }
}
```

Copy

Docs Vite # Vite Install and configure Vite. ### [Link to section](\#create-project) Create project Start by creating a new React project using `vite`: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm npm create vite@latest ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#add-tailwind-and-its-configuration) Add Tailwind and its configuration Install `tailwindcss` and its peer dependencies, then generate your `tailwind.config.js` and `postcss.config.js` files: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm npm install -D tailwindcss postcss autoprefixer npx tailwindcss init -p ``` Copy Add this import header in your main css file, `src/index.css` in our case: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm @tailwind base; @tailwind components; @tailwind utilities; /* ... */ ``` Copy Configure the tailwind template paths in `tailwind.config.js`: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ module.exports = { content: ["./index.html", "./src/**/*.{ts,tsx,js,jsx}"], theme: { extend: {}, }, plugins: [], } ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#edit-tsconfigjson-file) Edit tsconfig.json file The current version of Vite splits TypeScript configuration into three files, two of which need to be edited. Add the `baseUrl` and `paths` properties to the `compilerOptions` section of the `tsconfig.json` and `tsconfig.app.json` files: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm { "files": [], "references": [\ {\ "path": "./tsconfig.app.json"\ },\ {\ "path": "./tsconfig.node.json"\ }\ ], "compilerOptions": { "baseUrl": ".", "paths": { "@/*": ["./src/*"] } } } ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#edit-tsconfigappjson-file) Edit tsconfig.app.json file Add the following code to the `tsconfig.app.json` file to resolve paths, for your IDE: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm { "compilerOptions": { // ... "baseUrl": ".", "paths": { "@/*": [\ "./src/*"\ ] } // ... } } ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#update-viteconfigts) Update vite.config.ts Add the following code to the vite.config.ts so your app can resolve paths without error ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm # (so you can import "path" without error) npm i -D @types/node ``` Copy ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm import path from "path" import react from "@vitejs/plugin-react" import { defineConfig } from "vite" export default defineConfig({ plugins: [react()], resolve: { alias: { "@": path.resolve(__dirname, "./src"), }, }, }) ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#run-the-cli) Run the CLI Run the `shadcn-ui` init command to setup your project: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm npx shadcn@latest init ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#configure-componentsjson) Configure components.json You will be asked a few questions to configure `components.json`: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm Which style would you like to use? ‚Ä∫ New York Which color would you like to use as base color? ‚Ä∫ Zinc Do you want to use CSS variables for colors? ‚Ä∫ no / yes ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#thats-it) That's it You can now start adding components to your project. ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm npx shadcn@latest add button ``` Copy The command above will add the `Button` component to your project. You can then import it like this: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm import { Button } from "@/components/ui/button" export default function Home() { return (
) } ``` Copy [Next.js](/docs/installation/next) [Remix](/docs/installation/remix) On This Page - [Create project](#create-project) - [Add Tailwind and its configuration](#add-tailwind-and-its-configuration) - [Edit tsconfig.json file](#edit-tsconfigjson-file) - [Edit tsconfig.app.json file](#edit-tsconfigappjson-file) - [Update vite.config.ts](#update-viteconfigts) - [Run the CLI](#run-the-cli) - [Configure components.json](#configure-componentsjson) - [That's it](#thats-it) Bring your app built with shadcn to life on Vercel Trusted by OpenAI, Sonos, Chick-fil-A, and more. Vercel provides tools and infrastructure to deploy apps and features at scale. Deploy Now [Deploy to Vercel](https://vercel.com/new?utm_source=shadcn_site&utm_medium=web&utm_campaign=docs_cta_deploy_now_callout)

Docs Theming # Theming Using CSS Variables or Tailwind CSS for theming. You can choose between using CSS variables or Tailwind CSS utility classes for theming. ## [Link to section](\#utility-classes) Utility classes ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm
``` Copy To use utility classes for theming set `tailwind.cssVariables` to `false` in your `components.json` file. components.json ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm { "style": "default", "rsc": true, "tailwind": { "config": "tailwind.config.js", "css": "app/globals.css", "baseColor": "slate", "cssVariables": false }, "aliases": { "components": "@/components", "utils": "@/lib/utils" } } ``` Copy ## [Link to section](\#css-variables) CSS Variables ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm
``` Copy To use CSS variables for theming set `tailwind.cssVariables` to `true` in your `components.json` file. components.json ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm { "style": "default", "rsc": true, "tailwind": { "config": "tailwind.config.js", "css": "app/globals.css", "baseColor": "slate", "cssVariables": true }, "aliases": { "components": "@/components", "utils": "@/lib/utils" } } ``` Copy ### [Link to section](\#convention) Convention We use a simple `background` and `foreground` convention for colors. The `background` variable is used for the background color of the component and the `foreground` variable is used for the text color. The `background` suffix is omitted when the variable is used for the background color of the component. Given the following CSS variables: ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm --primary: 222.2 47.4% 11.2%; --primary-foreground: 210 40% 98%; ``` Copy The `background` color of the following component will be `hsl(var(--primary))` and the `foreground` color will be `hsl(var(--primary-foreground))`. ```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm
Hello
``` Copy **CSS variables must be defined without color space function**. markdown:
Docs

Introduction

# Introduction

Beautifully designed components that you can copy and paste into your apps. Accessible. Customizable. Open Source.

This is **NOT** a component library. It's a collection of re-usable components that you can copy and paste into your apps.

**What do you mean by not a component library?**

I mean you do not install it as a dependency. It is not available or distributed via npm.

Pick the components you need. Copy and paste the code into your project and customize to your needs. The code is yours.

_Use this as a reference to build your own component libraries._

## [Link to section](\#faq) FAQ

### Why copy/paste and not packaged as a dependency?

### Do you plan to publish it as an npm package?

### Which frameworks are supported?

### Can I use this in my project?

```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm
import {
  Accordion,
  AccordionContent,
  AccordionItem,
  AccordionTrigger,
} from "@/components/ui/accordion"
```

Copy

```relative rounded bg-muted px-[0.3rem] py-[0.2rem] font-mono text-sm
<Accordion type="single" collapsible>
  <AccordionItem value="item-1">
    <AccordionTrigger>Is it accessible?</AccordionTrigger>
    <AccordionContent>
      Yes. It adheres to the WAI-ARIA design pattern.
    </AccordionContent>
  </AccordionItem>
</Accordion>
```

Copy

This is how others will see you on the site.

Username

This is your public display name. It can be your real name or a pseudonym. You can only change this once every 30 days.

EmailSelect a verified email to displaym@example.comm@google.comm@support.com

You can manage verified email addresses in your [email settings](/examples/forms).

Bio

You can @mention other users and organizations to link to them.
